channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Patients at 6 polyclinics who test negative for coronavirus will get results by SMS
item.description:
May 04, 2020 4:35 PM

The remaining 12 polyclinics are expected to roll out this system for their patients by mid-May.

item.title: 573 new coronavirus cases in Singapore to bring total to 18,778
item.description:
May 04, 2020 3:10 PM

Five are Singaporeans and permanent residents while migrant workers living in dormitories continue to make up the bulk of the remaining cases.

item.title: Doctor suspended 3 years, fined $25,000 for overprescribing cough mixtures containing codeine
item.description:
May 04, 2020 2:23 PM

SINGAPORE - A doctor has been suspended for three years and fined $25,000 for overprescribing cough mixtures containing codeine to 10 patients.

item.title: Coronavirus: Man allegedly spat at cop after he was caught not wearing mask outdoors
item.description:
May 04, 2020 11:04 AM

SINGAPORE - A man is said to have hurled vulgarities at a policeman and spat at another officer after he was allegedly spotted not wearing a mask over his nose and mouth while outdoors on Saturday (May 2) amid the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on May 4
item.description:
May 04, 2020 7:42 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Monday, May 4.

item.title: 657 new cases in Singapore; 18 fatalities now as 86-year-old woman dies
item.description:
May 04, 2020 5:00 AM

The Ministry of Health (MOH) confirmed 657 new Covid-19 cases in Singapore as of noon yesterday, 95 per cent of whom were migrant workers in dormitories.

item.title: Home in focus: All in the same fight
item.description:
May 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Walking over to one of the portable beds, Dr Pang Ningyi, 35, delivers the swab test results to Mr Kamrul Hoque, who is lying on the bed.

item.title: Coronavirus: Parents and students see good and bad of remote learning
item.description:
May 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Ask parents and teachers how full remote learning, which started on April 8 and ends today, was and the answer is likely to be more good than bad.

item.title: Apex court acquits drug courier of one charge
item.description:
May 04, 2020 5:00 AM

The prosecution's practice of bringing two separate charges against an offender in relation to a single block of cannabis-related plant material is "indefensible" and "impermissible", the Court of Appeal said last Wednesday.

item.title: Coronavirus: How teachers with children manage dual roles as educators and parents
item.description:
May 04, 2020 5:00 AM

In the first week of full home-based learning (HBL) last month, there was apprehension as parents and children familiarised themselves with new routines.

item.title: Acres carries on with rescue efforts, but struggles to stay afloat
item.description:
May 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Hawkeye, a Forsten's tortoise, is native to Indonesia, but has found herself in Singapore as a victim of illegal wildlife trade in the region.

item.title: Wet market goes online to woo shoppers during circuit breaker
item.description:
May 04, 2020 5:00 AM

A pilot to bring the wet-market shopping experience online will be rolled out at one of Singapore's most famous markets tomorrow, in a bid to reduce crowds at wet markets and to make it easier for people to stay home during the ongoing Covid-19 outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus: Working from home to be the norm for some time, says Chan Chun Sing
item.description:
May 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Working from home will continue to be the norm even as circuit breaker measures are eased, said Minister for Trade and Industry Chan Chun Sing yesterday as he laid out Singapore's strategy for gradually reopening its economy.

item.title: Bipolar disorder can be treated
item.description:
May 04, 2020 5:00 AM

There is an old B-grade horror movie called Invasion Of The Body Snatchers.

item.title: Transport guru cuts teeth in commercial sector
item.description:
May 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Those who can't, teach may be an unfair adage, but it certainly does not apply to National University of Singapore (NUS) transport researcher Lee Der-Horng.

item.title: Coronavirus: Police investigating woman filmed flouting mask rule in viral video
item.description:
May 04, 2020 5:00 AM

A Singaporean woman who was filmed not wearing a mask at Shunfu Market and engaging passers-by in a heated argument is under investigation for voluntarily causing hurt, causing public nuisance and breaching safe distancing measures.

item.title: Coronavirus: More doctors attending to patients through video call
item.description:
May 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Ms Julie Kuah was suffering from a urinary tract infection and needed to see a doctor.

item.title: Singapore wildlife parks monitor animals for Covid-19
item.description:
May 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Wildlife parks, including the Singapore Zoo, are monitoring their captive animals for coronavirus infections after a tiger last month tested positive for the virus at New York City's Bronx Zoo.

item.title: Coronavirus: RSAF servicemen remain in camp to fulfil duties during circuit breaker period
item.description:
May 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Third Sergeant Colin Wong is not one to count the days till his operationally ready date (ORD) to return to civilian life.

item.title: Coronavirus: Attendance not compulsory for students allowed back to school in May
item.description:
May 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Precautions will be taken to keep students safe as they are allowed back to school, including institutes of higher learning, from May 19 but attendance is not compulsory.

item.title: 800 SIA cabin crew serving in new roles in Covid-19 fight
item.description:
May 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Leading steward Mohamad Faidhi Mohamad Ruzli, a 12-year veteran of Singapore Airlines (SIA), is still taking care of people, just not in the air.

item.title: Coronavirus: Restaurant owner and team feed the needy in Chinatown, come rain or shine
item.description:
May 04, 2020 5:00 AM

In the sweltering midday heat, Mr Bernard Teo and his team are handing out free food packs to a long queue that stretches along the Buddha Tooth Relic Temple in Chinatown.

item.title: Coping with rise in Covid-19 patients from dorms
item.description:
May 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Dr Lui To Hang, a medical officer at Ng Teng Fong General Hospital, communicating with a member of the nursing staff after doing an arterial blood gas test on a Covid-19 patient in the intensive care unit's negative pressure room

item.title: Coronavirus: OCBC donating another $1.23m to over 50,000 people
item.description:
May 04, 2020 5:00 AM

More than 50,000 people, including migrant workers, will receive supermarket vouchers or other necessities with a $1.23 million donation by OCBC Bank.

item.title: Coronavirus: Audio-visual lighting firm switches to food delivery to stay afloat
item.description:
May 04, 2020 5:00 AM

With a fleet of vehicles and manpower at the ready but no business amid the coronavirus outbreak, local audio-visual lighting and logistics firm UAV SG had to rethink its business model to stay afloat.

item.title: Flight to freedom
item.description:
May 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Birds being freed for Vesak Day at the Maha Bodhi School on May 26, 1964.

item.title: Meal subsidies to continue for needy students during school break
item.description:
May 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Meal subsidies for more than 47,000 primary and secondary school students from low-income families will continue over the month-long school break, which has been brought forward to begin tomorrow.

item.title: RCEP trade deal on track to be signed by year end, says Chan
item.description:
May 04, 2020 5:00 AM

The Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP) trade agreement remains on track to be signed by the year end, Trade and Industry Minister Chan Chun Sing said in an interview yesterday, during which he stressed the importance of international cooperation amid the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Songs and dances put up online for migrant workers throughout May
item.description:
May 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Concert performances by local Tamil, Bengali and Mandarin artists will be aired online daily through the month of May as part of the labour movement's May Day celebrations for migrant workers.

item.title: Essential business travel to resume first, says minister
item.description:
May 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Resuming international travel will require countries to coordinate standards of health checks as well as a system of tracking infected people, Trade and Industry Minister Chan Chun Sing said yesterday.

item.title: Social enterprise, eateries team up to deliver free meals in Bukit Merah
item.description:
May 04, 2020 5:00 AM

Every weekday, social enterprise Glyph delivers free lunch and dinner to 50 children and their families living in rental flats in Bukit Merah. The meals include rice with meat and vegetables, noodles or burgers.

item.title: Great Singapore Sale cancelled this year amid Covid-19 outbreak
item.description:
May 04, 2020 12:08 AM

SINGAPORE - There will be no Great Singapore Sale (GSS) this year.
